paper_abstract: Parallel algorithms used in Very Large Scale Integration physical design bring significant challenges for their efficient and effective design and implementation. The rectangle intersection problem is a subset of the plane sweep problem, a topic of computational geometry and a component in design rule checking, parasitic resistance-capacitance extraction, and mask processing flows. A variant of a plane sweep algorithm that is embarrassingly parallel and therefore easily scalable on multicore machines and clusters, while exceeding the best-known parallel plane sweep algorithms on real-world tests, is presented in this letter.
paper_title: A Variant of Parallel Plane Sweep Algorithm for Multicore Systems
